sub.description: Set or check the current Netplan 'renderer' (NetworkManager or networkd) for all interfaces.
sub.author: @tearran
sub.about: Provides a simple interface to toggle or display the Netplan network renderer. Does not manage service installation or enablement.

sub.description: Web-based administrative interface for managing Linux servers.
sub.author: @tearran
sub.about: Cockpit provides an easy-to-use, web-based graphical interface for system administration tasks such as managing users, services, storage, networking, and system updates. This module integrates Cockpit with Armbian Config V3, allowing users to install, remove, enable, disable, start, stop, and check the status of Cockpit directly from the config-ng menu or CLI.

Show available option groups and their usage for configng-v2 modules.
sub.author: @tearran
sub.about: Lists features/options for core, system, network, and software modules. Outputs usage and example commands for each group.

sub.description: Parse a list_options message and present commands as an interactive menu.
sub.author: @Tearran
sub.about: Displays available commands from a list_options message using whiptail, dialog, or terminal input. Returns the selected command for further processing.

sub.description: Lightweight timing and trace message utility for Configng V2 modules.
sub.author: @tearran
sub.about: Provides timing, tracing, and progress utilities for Bash modules. Supports trace timing and elapsed time reporting for module development and diagnostics.

Show an interactive ON/OFF checklist from columnar text using dialog, whiptail, or a simple read fallback.
sub.author: @Tearran
sub.about: extend_desc=This module provides a checklist UI for enabling/disabling items in scripts, compatible with dialog, whiptail, and a fallback read-mode for non-interactive terminals. Pass columnar text (item, description, status) via stdin or argument, and checklist_box will present an interactive selection. Outputs the selected items as a space-separated list for further scripting or configuration.

sub.description: Display a rolling info box with dialog/whiptail; reads and shows lines from stdin or a single message.
sub.author: @tearran
sub.about: This helper provides a live-updating infobox for progress or log output in TUI (dialog/whiptail). When piped, shows the last N lines as they arrive. If called with an argument, displays it as a static message. Useful for monitoring, user feedback, or background task reporting in config-v3.

sub.description: Prompt the user for input using whiptail, dialog, or shell fallback; reads prompt from argument or stdin and prints result to stdout.
sub.author: @tearran
sub.about: This helper displays an input box for user input in TUI environments using dialog, whiptail, or a shell fallback. The prompt message can be supplied as a positional argument or piped via stdin. If no prompt is provided, usage help is shown. Supports ARM and x86-64 architectures on Debian, Ubuntu, and Armbian systems (kernel 5.15+). Useful for scripts needing interactive input with fallback and help options.

sub.description: Displays an interactive menu for module functions based on their help output.
sub.author: @tearran
sub.about: Parses the help message of a given module and presents an interactive menu via dialog, whiptail, or CLI prompt.

sub.description: Displays a message to the user using the configured dialog tool.
sub.author: @tearran
sub.about: Reads input text (either from standard input or as an argument) and presents it to the user with the selected dialog frontend. Supports dialog, whiptail, or plain read/echo. Handles input flexibly and routes output appropriately depending on the tool.

sub.description: Helpers for bulk packages operations (install, remove, upgrade, etc.)
sub.author: @dimitry-ishenko
sub.about: Provides helpers for managing multiple package at once via apt and dpkg. Intended for use by configng-v2 core logic and scripts.

sub.description: Systemd service management helpers (start  stop  enable  etc.)
sub.author: @dimitry-ishenko
sub.about: Helpers for managing services programmatically via systemd. Intended for use by configng-v2 core logic and scripts.

sub.description: Set terminal and whiptail/dialog background colors.
sub.author: @Tearran
sub.about: This module provides functions to change the background color of the terminal and whiptail/dialog-based TUIs in configng-v2. Supports black, red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, and white color themes. Includes helpers for setting NEWT_COLORS for whiptail, ANSI background for most terminals, and resetting colors while preserving scrollback. Use set_colors <code> to apply a theme, where code is a number from 0 (black) to 7 (white).

sub.description: Portable Bash yes/no prompt function supporting whiptail, dialog, or simple shell read fallback.
sub.author: @tearran
sub.about: The yes_no_box helper provides a consistent, script-friendly way to prompt users for Yes/No confirmations across different environ
